PROJECT_DESC_EN: This project is to address homes which are experiencing dry wells as a result of the regional drought. There is currently a level 3 conservation warning encompassing the community and surrounding area. This is to provide water holding tanks for those homes affected and is to address health and safety concerns in the community. The school turbidity meter involved a minor cost to replace a failed component which failed summer 2016 (before the new water treatment plant came online). The school system has recently been replaced with the commissioning of a new water treatment plant in the community and has been decommissioned.

PROJECT_NAME_EN: Matawa Winter Road Realignments to Higher Ground
PROJECT_DESC_EN: To undertake multiple winter road realignment projects for the following First Nations: Eabametoong Marten Falls Neskantaga Nibinamik and Webequie. This realignment project will improve the existing winter road system by: lengthening the road operations from 5 to 8 weeks by realigning the roads off water and onto higher ground (Eabametoong) and over engineered structures at water crossings; improving operations and safety along the overall winter road system; and focusing capital expenditures on critical areas in the short term with potential for staged improvements to all-season roads over the long-term.

PROJECT_NAME_EN: Solid Waste Reduction and Management Plan
PROJECT_DESC_EN: Confederacy of Mainland Mi'kmaq has initiated this second phase to help their communities to reduce waste costs environmental impact and enhance community capacities. This project will be broken down into five initiatives: (1) They will help each community develop a waste management advisory committee. (2) They will work with each community to develop community specific community engagement awareness and capacity building sessions/initiatives. (3) They will help each community to review their municipal-type service agreements and develop bylaws and policies. (4) They will develop three pilot composting facilities: one each in Millbrook Sipekne'katik and Paqtnkek. (5) They will help each community develop non-traditional waste disposal and collection. Composting component - issues relating to waste diversion are leading to high tipping fees and are acting as a barrier to effective waste management. This is leading to higher operations and maintenance fees more illegal dumping/disposal more mass going to landfills and ultimately a larger environmental impact. By implementing a community composting program some of these issues would be addressed effectively. Additional cost of $27500.00.

PROJECT_NAME_EN: Mi혪kmawey Green Communities: Community Waste Audit and Community Service Vehicle Waste Audit
PROJECT_DESC_EN: To develop sustainable solid waste management systems in each community by doing waste audits for each community. This will help having a baseline in how they need to proceed in helping their communities reduce the amount of waste they produce and thereby reducing their associated fees and this will also help each band to effectively and sustainably manage their solid waste. Furthermore this information will benefit from this dataset and the Confederacy of Mainland Mi'kmaq will purchase a vehicle which will ensure that any of the solid waste community roadside cleanups and other solid waste initiatives requiring a vehicle will not impede on current community public works vehicles.

Paqtnkek proposes to develop a diversion centre this phase of the project will look at developing a request for proposals for the construction of the diversion centre and will include identification of a site surveying the site and designing a centre appropriate for this site.

PROJECT_NAME_EN: Solid Waste Reduction and Management Plan
PROJECT_DESC_EN: Confederacy of Mainland Mi'kmaq has initiated this second phase to help their communities to reduce waste costs environmental impact and enhance community capacities. This project will be broken down into five initiatives: (1) They will help each community develop a waste management advisory committee. (2) They will work with each community to develop community specific community engagement awareness and capacity building sessions/initiatives. (3) They will help each community to review their municipal-type service agreements and develop bylaws and policies. (4) They will develop three pilot composting facilities: one each in Millbrook Sipekne'katik and Paqtnkek. (5) They will help each community develop non-traditional waste disposal and collection. Composting component - issues relating to waste diversion are leading to high tipping fees and are acting as a barrier to effective waste management. This is leading to higher operations and maintenance fees more illegal dumping/disposal more mass going to landfills and ultimately a larger environmental impact. By implementing a community composting program some of these issues would be addressed effectively. Additional cost of $27500.00.

PROJECT_NAME_EN: Solid Waste Reduction and Management Plan
PROJECT_DESC_EN: Confederacy of Mainland Mi'kmaq has initiated this second phase to help their communities to reduce waste costs environmental impact and enhance community capacities. This project will be broken down into five initiatives: (1) They will help each community develop a waste management advisory committee. (2) They will work with each community to develop community specific community engagement awareness and capacity building sessions/initiatives. (3) They will help each community to review their municipal-type service agreements and develop bylaws and policies. (4) They will develop three pilot composting facilities: one each in Millbrook Sipekne'katik and Paqtnkek. (5) They will help each community develop non-traditional waste disposal and collection. Composting component - issues relating to waste diversion are leading to high tipping fees and are acting as a barrier to effective waste management. This is leading to higher operations and maintenance fees more illegal dumping/disposal more mass going to landfills and ultimately a larger environmental impact. By implementing a community composting program some of these issues would be addressed effectively. Additional cost of $27500.00.

PROJECT_NAME_EN: Waste Capacity Building and Needs Assessment

PROJECT_NAME_EN: Waste Management Vehicle and Organic Waste Feasibility Study
PROJECT_DESC_EN: Annapolis Valley will develop sustainable waste management systems. This means reducing the amount of waste generated reducing associated fees mitigating environmental impact(s) and developing tools for community administrators to effectively and sustainably manage solid waste. Furthermore the community will use the diverted organic material and turn it into useable compost to be used on the community garden distribute to private gardening projects restoration and beautification projects. This will include a feasibility study for a purchase of a truck to collect said compost and for the development of said compost facility and a future diversion centre.

PROJECT_DESC_EN: Confederacy of Mainland Mi'kmaq has initiated this second phase to help their communities to reduce waste costs environmental impact and enhance community capacities. This project will be broken down into five initiatives: (1) They will help each community develop a waste management advisory committee. (2) They will work with each community to develop community specific community engagement awareness and capacity building sessions/initiatives. (3) They will help each community to review their municipal-type service agreements and develop bylaws and policies. (4) They will develop three pilot composting facilities: one each in Millbrook Sipekne'katik and Paqtnkek. (5) They will help each community develop non-traditional waste disposal and collection. Composting component - issues relating to waste diversion are leading to high tipping fees and are acting as a barrier to effective waste management. This is leading to higher operations and maintenance fees more illegal dumping/disposal more mass going to landfills and ultimately a larger environmental impact. By implementing a community composting program some of these issues would be addressed effectively. Additional cost of $27500.00.

PROJECT_NAME_EN: Solid Waste Reduction and Management Plan
PROJECT_DESC_EN: Confederacy of Mainland Mi'kmaq has initiated this second phase to help their communities to reduce waste costs environmental impact and enhance community capacities. This project will be broken down into five initiatives: (1) They will help each community develop a waste management advisory committee. (2) They will work with each community to develop community specific community engagement awareness and capacity building sessions/initiatives. (3) They will help each community to review their municipal-type service agreements and develop bylaws and policies. (4) They will develop three pilot composting facilities: one each in Millbrook Sipekne'katik and Paqtnkek. (5) They will help each community develop non-traditional waste disposal and collection. Composting component - issues relating to waste diversion are leading to high tipping fees and are acting as a barrier to effective waste management. This is leading to higher operations and maintenance fees more illegal dumping/disposal more mass going to landfills and ultimately a larger environmental impact. By implementing a community composting program some of these issues would be addressed effectively. Additional cost of $27500.00.
